frame.name: Freeing_from_confinement
frame.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Agent</fen> causes a <fen>Theme</fen> which was held captive to be free from a <fen>Location_of_confinement</fen>, against the wishes of the captors.
<ex><fex name="Agent">Two men disguised as guards</fex> <t>sprung</t> <fex name="Theme">a convicted killer</fex> <fex name="Loc">from prison</fex> <fex name="Time">last night</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Agent
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Agent</fen> causes the confinement or captivity of the <fen>Theme</fen> to end, against the intentions of the captor.
<ex><fex name="age">Their buddies</fex> <t>sprung</t> them from prison.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Theme
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Theme</fen> is the person or object which is released by the <fen>Agent</fen>.
<ex>Unknown individuals <t>freed</t> <fex name="Theme">the suspect</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition:
<def-root>Any description of the release which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (<ment>quietly, loudly</ment>), and general descriptions comparing events (<ment>the same way</ment>). In addition, it may indicate salient characteristics of an <fen>Agent</fen> that also affect the action (<ment>presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully</ment>).
<ex>Not truly allies, they <t>freed</t> the suspect <fex name="Manner">carefully</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition:
<def-root>The action of the <fen>Agent</fen> which brings about the release.
<ex>He <t>freed</t> a hundred prisoners <fex name="Means">by disabling the transport vehicle and gassing the guards</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Explanation</fen> identifies the reason for which the <fen>Agent</fen> sets the <fen>Theme</fen> free.
<ex>Enemy fighters <t>freed</t> those two captives <fex name="Explanation">because they had knowledge necessary to mount a larger assault against our position</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Purpose</fen> identifies the purpose for which the <fen>Agent</fen> releases the <fen>Theme</fen>. </def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition:
<def-root>The location where the <fen>Theme</fen> ceases to be confined.
<ex>They <t>sprung</t> us <fex name="Place">on the highway</fex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Location_of_confinement
FE.definition:
<def-root>The location to which the <fen>Theme</fen>'s motion was formerly inhibited.
<ex>Johnny <t>sprung</t> me <fex name="Loc">from prison</fex> and I've never forgiven him since.</ex>
</def-root>

FE.name: Concessive
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE signifies that the state of affairs expressed by the main clause (containing the target) occurs or holds, and something other than that state of affairs would be expected given the state of affairs in the concessive clause.</def-root>

FE.name: Circumstances
FE.definition: <def-root>The state of the world when the event of setting free occurs. </def-root>
